apps.title: Lätt
apps.short_description: Photo film emulation filters and editor

content.text: Lätt is a pro photo filter app that emulates read film stock.

apps.title: Redaktör
apps.short_description: A text editor designed for use with Termux and external keyboards

content.text: A text editor designed for use with Termux and external keyboards, Redaktör uses Androids 'Storage Access Framework' which allows read/write access to files in device storage, Termux, Google Drive and other services. When using with a physical keyboard standard shortcuts are available (ctrl-o, ctrl-s, ctrl-n for open/save/new).
A floating settings screen includes dark and light themes and font choices
Markdown support includes syntax highlighting and a preview screen

apps.title: EnkelDraw
apps.short_description: A simple drawing app for children

content.text: My daughter enjoyed scribbling with the drawing mode in Google Keep but kept losing the canvas due to so many ways to navigate away. EnkelDraw fairs much better, young children are less likely to exit the app which makes the experience more fun for children and parents.
There's also a popup colour picker and an option to save the images locally. EnkelDraw can also be installed on a desktop computer (view the site using Chrome).

apps.title: Fotoram
apps.short_description: A widget to place photos on your phone home screen

content.text: There are a lot of these widgets on the Play Store but they're all poorly executed. This project is quick, supports high res images, will auto-rotate photos to the correct orientation, and stores images internally (no permissions issues)

Skiss is a very lightweight and performant Android framework for 2D generative animations. The syntax closely mimics the Processing (www.processing.org) api so sketches can easily be ported between the two.
Skiss is fully open source and free to use, it's a fairly niche use case: 2D animations using basic primitives, but the standard View Canvas is available for more control and it's easy to extend.
